solution.text:
Let the root of the quadratic equation be a and b.
According to the given condition,
\(AM=\frac{a+b}{2}=_{p}_\) i.e \(a+b=_{{2*p}}_\)
\(GM=(ab)^{\frac{1}{2}}=_{q}_\) i.e \(ab=_{{q**2}}_\)
The quadratic equation is given by
\(x^2-x\)(sum of roots)\(+\)(product of roots)=0
\(x^2-x(a+b)+(ab)=0\)
\(x^2-_{{2*p}}_x+_{{q**2}}_=0\)

content.text: If A.M. and G.M. of roots of a quadratic equation are _{p}_ and _{q}_, respectively, then obtain the quadratic equation.
